title: The Chase's Paul Sinha takes aim at Mark Labbett for 'f***ing cousin'
text:
Mark Labbett was put in Paul Sinha’s sight during a stand-up show (Picture: Getty, PA)

Paul ‘The Sinnerman’ Sinha took aim at his co-stars on The Chase and labelled bosses racist – before slamming Mark ‘The Beast’ Labbett for ‘f***ing his cousin’.

The quizmaster was performing a stand-up routine in Lewisham when he turned the tables on his on-screen co-stars.

‘Anne Hegerty is called The Governess because she is bossy and cruel, and Mark Labbett is known as the Beast because he is f***ing his cousin. It is a distant cousin,’ he told the Lewisham audience.

‘Spare a thought for Shaun Wallace. He has been a barrister for 30 years and what do they call him? The Dark Destroyer? Because low evil racism is still allowed on an ITV game show.’

He referred to himself as ‘the t**t in the white suit’.

Metro.co.uk has contacted The Chase reps for comment.

Paul accused show bosses racist for calling Shaun Wallace ‘The Dark Destroyer’ (Picture: ITV)

Paul’s co-star Mark, 54, raised eyebrows when he married 26-year-old Katie in 2014, and then revealed that they were second cousins.

However they added that they ‘weren’t aware’ of their connection at the time of their marriage.

They suffered a ‘rough patch’ earlier this year when it was claimed that Katie had found love with another man, dating him for almost a year.

But they worked through their issues and in September they announced they were back together.

They have a young son, who they opt to keep away from the limelight.

The Chase airs weeknights at 5pm on ITV.
